Simple_grid_graph_demo package

Submodules

simple_grid_graph_demo module

CoBeLRL.demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.rewardCallback(values)

This is a callback function that defines the reward provided to the robotic agent. Note: this function has to be adopted to the current experimental design. This is flexible enough to accommodate for different experimental setups.

Parameters

values – a dict of values that are transferred from the OAI module to the reward function

Returns reward

reward value

Returns stopEpisode

flag set to true/false

CoBeLRL.demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.trialBeginCallback(trial, rlAgent)

This is a callback function that is called in the beginning of each trial. Here, experimental behavior can be defined (ABA renewal and the like).

Parameters

  • trial – the number of the finished trial

  • rlAgent – the employed reinforcement learning agent

Returns

None

CoBeLRL.demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.trialEndCallback(trial, rlAgent, logs)

This is a callback routine that is called when a single trial ends. Here, functionality for performance evaluation can be introduced.

Parameters

  • trial – the number of the finished trial

  • rlAgent – the employed reinforcement learning agent

  • logs – output of the reinforcement learning subsystem

Returns

None

CoBeLRL.demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.singleRun()

This method performs a single experimental run, i.e. one experiment. It has to be called by either a parallelization mechanism (without visual output), or by a direct call (in this case, visual output can be used). combinations: this is a combination of parameters used for a single experiment. Note: the combination values depend on the experimental design!

Param

None

Returns

None

simple_grid_graph_demo_with_rotation module

CoBeLRL.demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.simple_grid_graph_demo_with_rotation.rewardCallback(values)

This is a callback function that defines the reward provided to the robotic agent. Note: this function has to be adopted to the current experimental design. This is flexible enough to accommodate for different experimental setups.

Parameters

values – a dict of values that are transferred from the OAI module to the reward function

Returns reward

reward value

Returns stopEpisode

flag set to true/false

CoBeLRL.demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.simple_grid_graph_demo_with_rotation.trialBeginCallback(trial, rlAgent)

This is a callback function that is called in the beginning of each trial. Here, experimental behavior can be defined (ABA renewal and the like).

Parameters

  • trial – the number of the finished trial

  • rlAgent – the employed reinforcement learning agent

Returns

None

CoBeLRL.demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.simple_grid_graph_demo_with_rotation.trialEndCallback(trial, rlAgent, logs)

This is a callback routine that is called when a single trial ends. Here, functionality for performance evaluation can be introduced.

Parameters

  • trial – the number of the finished trial

  • rlAgent – the employed reinforcement learning agent

  • logs – output of the reinforcement learning subsystem

Returns

None

CoBeLRL.demo.simple_grid_graph_demo.simple_grid_graph_demo_with_rotation.singleRun()

This method performs a single experimental run, i.e. one experiment. It has to be called by either a parallelization mechanism (without visual output), or by a direct call (in this case, visual output can be used). combinations: this is a combination of parameters used for a single experiment. Note: the combination values depend on the experimental design!
